snippet: President Obama’s proposal to trim future Medicare and Social Security benefits as part of a deficit compromise could force Democrats to take an uncomfortable stand on a measure that is unpopular with their base.
abstract: Pres Obama's budget proposal, which puts Social Security and Medicare benefits on negotiating table, could force Democrats to take uncomfortable stand on measure that is unpopular with their base; liberal groups and some union activists are threatening to challenge Democrats in primaries, and Republicans have signaled that they would use proposal against Democrats in 2014 midterm elections.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s proposal to trim future Medicare and Social Security benefits as part of a deficit compromise could force Democrats to take an uncomfortable stand on a measure that is unpopular with their base.

headline.seo: President Obama’s Budget Revives Benefits as Divisive Issue
headline.main: Obama’s Budget Revives Benefits as Divisive Issue
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Budget Revives Benefits as Divisive Issue
